intro: Rumex ponticus, commonly known as the Pontic sorrel, is a perennial herb native to southeastern Europe and western Asia. It features a basal rosette of lanceolate, reddish-veined leaves and produces dense clusters of greenish-yellow flowers in late spring. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and is often found in moist, calcareous soils. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, known for its distinctive leaf morphology and edible leaves. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
